description: Comprehensive development and refinement of the OneClouds project, focusing on robust authentication, granular access control via Metadata and Full Access modes, and enhanced cloud storage integration. Addressed numerous technical challenges in backend logic, API integrations, and frontend UI/UX to deliver a production-ready application with strong security and privacy principles.
key_features_implemented: User Registration with Gmail-only email validation
Email-based 2FA (OTP) for registration and trusted device login
User Login with 'Stay logged in' functionality and trusted device management
Account lockout and rate limiting for security
User Mode Selection (Metadata Mode / Full Access Mode) post-login
Mode-based permission enforcement on backend API endpoints
Audit logging for sensitive actions (e.g., mode changes, account deletions)
File Metadata Synchronization (automatic and manual triggers)
Cross-cloud File Listing, Search, and Duplicate Detection (mode-aware)
Secure handling of cloud provider tokens (encryption at rest)
Refactored backend to use `AuthHandler` instance methods for JWT management
Updated frontend to support new authentication flows, 2FA, and mode selection UI
Resolved numerous frontend dependency and React Hook compatibility issues with Material-UI
Corrected OAuth redirect handling for Google Drive and Dropbox
technical_highlights: FastAPI backend with SQLAlchemy ORM for data persistence
React.js frontend with Material-UI for responsive UI
PyOTP for TOTP generation and verification
JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for authentication and authorization (access and refresh tokens)
OAuth 2.0 for delegated authorization with Google Drive, Dropbox, OneDrive
Fernet (symmetric encryption) for sensitive token storage
Background Tasks for non-blocking operations like file sync
Robust error handling and logging across services
Adherence to security best practices (CSRF protection, secure cookies, least privilege scopes)
next_steps_recommendations: Implement Google Drive to Google Drive server-side migration as per detailed plan.
Implement inter-cloud migration (e.g., Google Drive to Dropbox) considering server-side copy limitations.
Develop a comprehensive test suite (unit, integration, E2E) for all new features.
Enhance storage usage and quota display on the frontend with real-time updates.
Further refine UI/UX for file management (move, copy, rename) and job progress tracking.
Explore advanced search functionalities and filters for files and duplicates.
Implement file preview and download for Full Access Mode.
Consider adding more cloud providers (e.g., S3, Azure Blob Storage).
final_notes: The project now includes a robust and secure foundation for multi-cloud storage management with a strong emphasis on user privacy and data security. The dual-mode access provides flexibility while ensuring strict control over file content access. All core authentication, authorization, and basic file management functionalities are in place, making it ready for further feature expansion.
